message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper is about deep learning models for natural language processing (NLP), which is a subfield of computer science that falls under the category of "Computation and Language" (cs.CL). The paper specifically focuses on word representations, which are a key component of many NLP models. Given that the paper introduces a new type of word representation that significantly improves the state of the art on several NLP tasks, it is likely to be relevant to several other sub-categories of CS as well. 

The paper's use of deep learning models suggests that it may also be relevant to "Machine Learning" (cs.LG) and "Artificial Intelligence" (cs.AI). The fact that the paper's models are pre-trained on a large text corpus suggests that it may also be relevant to "Neural and Evolutionary Computing" (cs.NE). Finally, the paper's focus on NLP tasks such as question answering and sentiment analysis suggests that it may also be relevant to "Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition" (cs.CV), which often involves analyzing natural language descriptions of images.
